intro: Kibessia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy kibessia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Kibessia pubescens is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
